compositeCheatsheet.name: Getting some data into Debrief NG

taskGroup.name: Getting started with Debrief NG
taskGroup.intro: This series of cheatsheets will guide you through creating your Debrief working environment, customising it according to your preferred file locations, and loading some analysis data. If you wish, you can widen this 'Welcome' panel to make the tutorials easier to read. You may also find it easier to work through these cheat-sheets if you make the bottom section of this pane taller by dragging the central 'grab' bar vertically upwards

taskGroup.name: Defining your workspace
taskGroup.intro: In comparison with prior versions of Debrief, Debrief NG introduces the concept of a Workspace - a central repository for your assorted analysis-related documents. Within this workspace your work is grouped into individual projects: thus you can quickly switch between concurrent analysis tasks. Debrief's provision of projects allows you to quickly drag and drop Debrief data-files and plots.
taskGroup.onCompletion: Right, Debrief now knows where to find your data. In the next series of steps you will load and examine some data.

task.name: Generating a project
task.intro: Right, we'll start off by creating a Project that will contain our work
task.onCompletion: You've now created a project into which you can store your Debrief data

task.name: Finding your data
task.intro: If you already have one or more folders containing Debrief data, you can add them to your Debrief NG project (or load sample data that was installed within Debrief NG). If you've haven't got any sample data, or if you can already see the Sample Data folder in your Navigator, you can skip this task.
task.onCompletion: You can now repeat this process to create links to your other Debrief data directories.

task.name: Configuring library data
task.intro:
Debrief can plot information from library datasets to add context to the current view. Because of their typical size, these datasets are not distributed with Debrief, but should be obtained separately.
If you don't hold a VPF CD, or the ~200Mb ETOPO.RAW file, you may skip this task.

taskGroup.name: Viewing some data
taskGroup.intro: This series of steps will guide you through creating then populating a new Debrief plot.

task.name: Creating a new plot
task.intro: We will now use Debrief's New Plot wizard to create a plot ready for import of data-files.
task.onCompletion: Note that we didn't have to use the wizard steps, we could have inserted chart features into our Plot by hand using the Chart Features menu.

task.name: Importing some existing data
task.intro: At last we're about to view some actual vessel tracks.

task.name: Make some changes
task.intro: Now we've got a complex plot open, we'll experiment with making some changes to it.

task.name: Learn more about the UI
task.intro: Here you'll learn more about the Debrief user interface
task.onCompletion:
You've now mastered the initial steps of using Debrief. NoPrint
